event.title: about one million years old, and part of the Harbour Fault which also includes

data.event: It is about one million years old, and part of the Harbour Fault which also includes Mount Hikurangi near Hikurangi, and Parahaki in Whangarei.
Tunnelling first started in 1875, but it was not practical to carry the coal over the unmetalled roads to Whangarei wharf.

event.title: 1882 a short railway line was completed

data.event: In 1882 a short railway line was completed between Kamo and Whangarei to carry the coal.
The mine closed in 1955, with the seams worked out.
A Wesleyan church was built in 1881, the Anglican All Saints Church in 1886, and a Presbyterian church in 1911.
The first Roman Catholic church in the Whangarei area opened in Kamo about 1881.
